exc_days_pl:
Instruction:

Weekly: Range from Monday to Sunday (indicated by 1~7).
EX: input 1_6_7 if you wish not to receive the alert on Monday, Saturday, and Sunday..

Monthly: Range is from 1st to 31st (indicated by 1~31).
EX: input 1_15_30 if you wish not to receive the alert on the 1st, 15th and 30th of each month.

validation.ipaddress: This IP address is not valid for this field.
validation.maxlength: Please enter no more than {{value}} characters.
validation.aliasmaxlength: Please enter no more than {{value}} characters (Note: Chinese character counts as 2 characters).

validation.stringname: Characters restricted to English characters, numbers, underline(_) and dash(-) only
validation.stringname_space: Characters restricted to English characters, numbers, space character, underline(_) and dash(-) only
validation.stringcode: Characters restricted to English characters, number, underline(_), dash(-) and dot(.) only
validation.stringchart: Characters restricted to English characters, number, underline(_), dash(-), dot(.) and at(@) only

validation.stringalias_space: Characters restricted to Chinese and English characters, as well as numbers, space character, underline(_) and dash(-) only

upload_info: Image shall be JPG, PNG or GIF. Image pixel shall be 240px*240px and within 5MB.

date_range_required_if_exist: Start Date, Expiry Date required if exist.
sdate_over_edate: Expiry date cannot be earlier than start date
stime_over_etime: End time cannot be earlier than start time
proxy_path_tip:
For example: target URL is a.b.c/a1/a2, proxy path is /x1/x2.
The target URL is a.b.c/a1/a2/{id}, and the proxy path is /x1/x2/{p}.
The target URL is a.b.c/a1/a2/{id1}/a3/{id2}, and the proxy path is /x1/{p}/x2/{p}.
Note: The first character is /, if there is a parameter, please use {p}.
equal100: The total number of chances must be 100

x_api_key.add_tip: Enter an alias, and we will generate a unique X-Api-Key and notify the client via email.

api_url_setting_tip:
Enter the target URL to replace or search. Full or partial matches are both acceptable.
e.g., https://127.0.0.1:8080/query, 127.0.0.1:8080, 8080
label_reset_tip: API1 has label1, label2, API2 has label1, label3. After entering label4 and label5 with this function, all tags for API1 and API2 will be reset to label4 and label5.
cfm_reset_label: Existing labels will be cleared. Confirm reset?

fail_discovery_policy.label: Failure Determination Policy
fail_discovery_policy.policy_0: When the connection fails, or the HTTP status code is 4xx (Client Error), 5xx (Server Error)
fail_discovery_policy.tip: Only 'Registered API (dgrc)' supports this policy function. Other API source types do not support it.

fail_handle_policy.label: Failure Handling Policy
fail_handle_policy.policy_1: When the target URL call fails, automatically retry the next target URL
fail_handle_policy.tip: Only 'Registered API (dgrc)' supports this policy function. Other API source types do not support it.

funcCode_kibana_prefix: Fill in the information after ip:port or domain

client_related.import_tip:
1. Data Status:
1.1. Add
1.2. Duplicate
1.3. Overwrite
1.4. Unable to Add (this may prevent the import operation from proceeding)
1.5. Unable to Overwrite
2. Please re-import after correcting the data, such as missing APIs, inability to add, or inability to overwrite
3. Please import API-related information first, then client-related information
client_related.lack_tip:
1. API usage of the client in 'Authorization', 'Scope', and 'DGR API KEY'
2. Please import API-related information first, then client-related information
3. If any missing API is corrected, please re-import client-related information
client_related.cofirm_by_lack: Confirm to ignore missing client-used APIs. If not checked, import operations will not proceed. Please re-import after correcting.
client_related.cover_all_tip: Overwrite means adopting the new values and retaining the original ones if they are not duplicated
client_related.client_info_tip:
1. Functions include basic information, authorization-related settings, DGR API KEY, GTW OAuth 2.0 IdP, GTW LDAP IdP, GTW API IdP, GTW JDBC IdP
2. Duplication is determined based on the client account
3. If the code or name already exists, it cannot be added or overwritten
4. If there is a duplicate record of the hostname or IP in the host list, it cannot be overwritten
5. Password and incorrect password count will not be overwritten
6. Different security levels cannot be overwritten
7. Data status in red text means it will not be processed
8. APIs used by the Developer Portal will be migrated regardless of their deployment status, e.g., application authorization APIs and login consent APIs
client_related.group_tip:
1. Duplication is determined based on the group code
2. If the name already exists, it cannot be added or overwritten
3. If any item is in the state of 'Unable to Add', the import operation cannot proceed
client_related.vgroup_tip:
1. Duplication is determined based on the scope code
2. If the name already exists, it cannot be added or overwritten
3. APIs exceeding 186 cannot be overwritten
4. Data status in red text means it will not be processed
5. If any item is in the state of 'Unable to Add', the import operation cannot proceed
client_related.group_auth_tip:
1. Duplication is determined based on the authentication code
2. If the name already exists, it cannot be added or overwritten
3. Data status in red text means it will not be processed
4. If any item is in the state of 'Unable to Add', the import operation cannot proceed
client_related.security_level_tip:
1. Duplication is determined based on the security level code
2. If the name already exists, it cannot be added or overwritten
3. Data status in red text means it will not be processed
4. If any item is in the state of 'Unable to Add', the import operation cannot proceed
client_related.cfm_import: Confirm to import new and overwrite data?
client_related.CA_reject_tip: If any item in the API Group, API Scope, Authentications, or Security Level is in the state of 'Unable to Add', the import operation cannot proceed
client_related.rdb_connection_tip:
1. Duplication is determined based on Connection Name
2. HikariConfig Data Source Properties will fully adopt new values for overwriting
3. Data status in red text means it will not be processed

click_drop_img: Click to select or Drag and drop image here.
check_filename_before_import: File names will be checked during import. Do not change the file name.
import_key_tip: Use {{key}} as the basis. Update if duplicated, otherwise add.
target_url_remove_n_import: When updating, delete the target URL and then import the new target URL.
export_dont_modify: Do not modify the JSON file content after exporting to avoid system errors during import.

apiStatus.noScheduleLaunchedDiscontinuation: If a scheduled date is not set, the system will activate/deactivate immediately.

main_func_tip.1: Confirm that the language is configured in the main menu
main_func_tip.2: Kibana reports are set under the Reports section

embedded_url_tip.2: The content of the Kibana Report starts after the ip:port or domain, and the reports are always located under the Reports section in the main menu
embedded_url_tip.3: The URL of the Embedded Page contains '/dgrv4/cus/', and the location is determined by the main menu
embedded_url_tip.4: The URL of the External Page does not contain '/dgrv4/cus/', and the location is determined by the main menu
embedded_url_tip.5: Do not change the Kibana Report type to Embedded Page or External Page types
embedded_url_tip.6: Do not change Embedded Page or External Page types to the Kibana Report type

url_contains_keyword: URL contains keywords ({{key}}) for embedded pages
url_dont_contains_keyword: URL does not contain keywords ({{key}}) to open a new page
noCusInfo: No available CUS information has been set
cusName_tip: Create a CUS login button on the DGR AC login screen. This field sets the button name, with the default value as 'CUS'
cusLoginUrl_tip: The destination to redirect to when clicking the CUS login button on the DGR AC login screen. The URL of the CUS login page should be entered in this field.
cusBackendLoginUrl_tip: URL to trigger CUS login. The URL used for CUS login should be entered here.
cusUserDataUrl_tip: API URL for DGR to retrieve user data. The CUS must provide an API that allows DGR to obtain the corresponding user data.
cusUrlExp:
Please follow these rules when entering URLs:

1. The URL must start with `http://` or `https://` 
2. The URL must be a valid and complete web address

## Correct Examples:
- https://www.example.com
- http://subdomain.example.com/page
- https://www.example.com/path/to/resource?param=value

## Incorrect Examples:
- www.example.com (missing protocol)
- ftp://example.com (unsupported protocol)
- https://(incomplete URL)
redirectURItip:
Please abide by the following rules when entering the URI:

1. The URI must start with a protocol
2. If it starts with `http://` or `https://`, it must be a legal and complete URL format and cannot contain * 
 e.g. https://www.example.com
3. If it starts with other protocols, it must include *
 e.g. myapp://example/*

## Error example: 
- www.example. com (missing protocol)
- https://www.example.com/* (* not allowed)
- https:// (incomplete)
- myapp://example/ (missing *)
allowlist_rule_tip: Enter regular expressions and the User-Agent header will be checked
date_duration_tip: When the start time is empty, it means to start immediately. When the end time is empty, it means to never end.
date_duration_start: When the start time is empty, it means to start immediately.
date_duration_end: When the end time is empty, it means to never end.
api_abnormal_greater_than: Response failed or elapsed time is greater than
api_abnormal_failures: Only respond to failures (HTTP status code >= 400)

grpc.cert_tip_1: 1. Content must be in text format (Base64 encoded).
grpc.cert_tip_3:
3. The content must include the full block from
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
to
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
grpc.cert_tip_4: 4. If your certificate is stored inside a PKCS#12 keystore:
grpc.cert_tip_4_1: 4.1. For example: example.p12 is a PKCS#12 keystore (containing an X.509 certificate and private key).
grpc.cert_tip_4_2:
4.2. You can convert it into a PEM file (which will include both the private key and the certificate) using:
openssl pkcs12 -nodes -in example.p12 -out example.pem -passin pass:example
grpc.cert_tip_4_3:
4.3. Open example.pem and locate the certificate block:
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIFwjCCA6qgAwIBAgIIHrR+pmyYcSUwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEMBQAwgYYxGDAWBgNV
......
pY2+3U1hLAs6pNrmuSpGrbQa6QEx21jO7HCON7Ds/5Cl3ZCWlg4=
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
Copy and paste the entire block exactly as shown.

recent_api_abnormal_each_node: Observe the API with the most recent abnormal response from each node
